question: Which of the following correctly defines the term ‘Mosaicism’ which was in the news, in context of the field of science and technology?
option1: It is a condition in which the human brain remains disoriented for most of the conscious period
option2: It is the pattern of color on the skin of reptiles
option3: It is the condition where cells within the same person have a different genetic makeup
option4: It is the hybrid of a solar and hydrogen fueled vehicle
answer: It is a condition in which the human brain remains disoriented for most of the conscious period
explanation: Mosaicism is a condition in which cells within the same person have a different genetic makeup. It is caused by an error in cell division very early in the development of the unborn baby. It is called “mosaicism” because, in a way, the cells of the body are different but are collected in the same structure like a mosaic. For example, if an individual has mosaic trisomy 18, this means that some of the cells have three copies of chromosome 18 while other cells have two copies of chromosome 18. This usually leads to genetic and congenital disorders such as Down’s syndrome etc.
